body:
Alright, I managed to make the problem go away by:

1. Not modifying the child owned entity and replacing the entire owned entity instead

Is this intentional behavior, or a bug?

It's definitely a bug - we should never throw exception like that
possibly related to https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/33452

Well that's awkward, I remember writing in repro code into this, but upon revisiting this issue I see now such thing in the description. ðŸ˜¬ 

I must have never clicked save, cripes.

issue.title: Fix: Value cannot be null parameter name key

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
When using ToJson for another entity within a JSON column, no corresponding column is found for that entity, resulting in a [null value](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/blob/f90a768a7f6fe2dbe80d69331e4efa8e82fa4b97/src/EFCore.Relational/Update/ModificationCommand.cs#L676). Additionally, a null exception is thrown when the [TryGetValue](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/blob/f90a768a7f6fe2dbe80d69331e4efa8e82fa4b97/src/EFCore.Relational/Update/ModificationCommand.cs#L690) method is used within a dictionary.

Fixes #33831

issue.title: Throw when a nested entity type is mapped to a different JSON column.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'key')

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
### Bug description

EF Core throws `System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'key')` exception when you try to insert or update an entity with a Json property.


### Your code

```csharp
Sample project: https://github.com/AndreiShenets/ef-bug-json-props
```

### Stack traces

```text
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Update.Internal.BatchExecutor.ExecuteAsync(IEnumerable`1 commandBatches, IRelationalConnection connection, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.RelationalDatabase.SaveChangesAsync(IList`1 entries, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ChangeTracking.Internal.StateManager.SaveChangesAsync(IList`1 entriesToSave, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ChangeTracking.Internal.StateManager.SaveChangesAsync(StateManager stateManager, Boolean acceptAllChangesOnSuccess, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.ExecutionStrategy.<>c__DisplayClass30_0`2.<<ExecuteAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---

   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.ExecutionStrategy.ExecuteImplementationAsync[TState,TResult](Func`4 operation, Func`4 verifySucceeded, TState state, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.ExecutionStrategy.ExecuteAsync[TState,TResult](TState state, Func`4 operation, Func`4 verifySucceeded, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContext.SaveChangesAsync(Boolean acceptAllChangesOnSuccess, CancellationToken cancellationToken)

   at Program.SeedDatabaseAsync(DatabaseContext context) in P:\ef-bug-json-props\src\Program.cs:line 114
   at Program.RecreateDatabaseAsync(IHost app) in P:\ef-bug-json-props\src\Program.cs:line 69
   at Program.<Main>$(String[] args) in P:\ef-bug-json-props\src\Program.cs:line 46
```

### EF Core version

9.0.1

### Database provider

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer

### Target framework

.NET 9.0

### Operating system

Windows 11

issue.title: EFCore logging is insufficient to troubleshoot an exception

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
### Bug description

I added a couple of properties to a model, re-created the (SQLite) database and all migrations from scratch.
Now I can't store my entity because EFCore throws "Value cannot be null (Parameter 'key')" for some internal dictionary key, but it's not clear what do I need to fix from the exception.

* I made sure to run `Update-Database`
* I tried creating a new migration, it was empty
* I enabled console logging and enabled sensitive logging - not useful

EFCore needs trace messages that describe its intent in a way that allows troubleshooting.

### Your code

```csharp
This is what I added to a previously working setup:

 c#
 public class EndpointConfig {

....
  public string SerializedExporterConfig { get; set; } = string.Empty;

  private List<IEndpointExporterConfig> _exporterConfig = [];
  [NotMapped]
  public List<IEndpointExporterConfig> ExporterConfigs {get{...} set {...}} // serializes to the string
....
   public EndpointTelemetryConfig TelemetryConfig { get; set; } = new EndpointTelemetryConfig();
....  


`EndpointTelemetryConfig` class has this property:
`public List<FieldConfig> FieldConfigs { get; set; } = [];`
This property is mapped as json in my ApplicationDbContext.
This structure has not been changed (checked git history) and it was previously working, but it's the only one that could provoke "handleJson" in the exception stack

#
 protected override void OnModelCreating(ModelBuilder modelBuilder)
 {
     modelBuilder.Entity<EndpointConfig>(epc =>
     {
         epc.HasKey(e => e.EndpointId);
         epc.Property(e => e.SerializedProviderConfig).IsRequired();

         epc.OwnsOne(e => e.TelemetryConfig, tc =>
         {
             tc.ToJson();
             tc.OwnsMany(t => t.FieldConfigs, fc =>
             {
                 fc.ToJson();
             });
         }); 
     });
```

### Stack traces

```text
      SELECT "e"."UserId", "e"."EndpointId", "e"."IsAdmin"
```
